domain.name: General
domain.description: The general functional domain contains clusters and information that provides generally applicable functions and attributes that are not specific to other functional domains.

cluster.name: Basic
cluster.description: Attributes for determining basic information about a device, setting user device information such as description of location, and enabling a device.

value.name: Emergency mains constantly powered with battery backup
Emergency mains and transfer switch with battery backup

attribute.name: Generic Device Class
attribute.description: IKEA control outlet specific.

attribute.name: Generic Device Type
attribute.description: IKEA control outlet specific.

attribute.name: Product code
attribute.description: As printed on the product.

attribute.name: Tuya magic spell final attribute
attribute.description: Read attributes in this order Manufacturer name,ZCL version,Application version,Model Identifier,Power source and finally this one"

value.name: Mud Room (small room for coats and boots)

attribute.name: Sensitivity
attribute.description: Hue motion sensor related SML001

attribute.name: Configuration
attribute.description: TODO flags are only known for hue dimmer switch

value.name: 0x00 - LED disabled, 0x01 - Enable periodic fault flashes

attribute.name: Dimming brightness curve
attribute.description: Works after reset power of the device. 0: linear, 15: logarithmic with gamma value 1.5, 18: logarithmic with gamma value 1.8

attribute.name: Motion sensor daylight sensor lux threshold
attribute.description: 2 bytes, only when the detected lux is lower than the threshold, turning on the light is permitted. For instance, with value 0x0000, this function does not work.

attribute.name: Motion sensor operation mode
attribute.description:
0: means auto mode, 1: means manual mode
Auto mode means that when a motion is detected, the device will output PWM according to the set brightness threshold, and delay time. PWM status needs to be reported to the gateway.
Manual mode means that PWM output is controlled and determined by the gateway or the wireless switch, not associated with motion detection.

attribute.name: Motion sensor sensitivity setting
attribute.description: Works after reset power of the device. 1 byte, data range 0-15, 0 is the highest sensitivity, 15 is the lowest sensitivity.

attribute.name: Motion sensor microwave detection
attribute.description: Works after reset power of the device. 0: disabled, 1: enabled.

attribute.name: Send ON/OFF command to the touchlink devices
attribute.description: Works after reset power of the device. Configuration of whether to send ON/OFF command to the touchlink devices and binding devices. 0=do not send, 1=send

attribute.name: Brightness module
attribute.description: 0=disabled, 1=enabled

attribute.name: Light on time
attribute.description: Light on time (the first delay time). Works after reset power of the device. When motion sensor mode is set as auto mode, and motion is detected, after the person leaves, light on time of the device. 2 bytes, unit is second.

attribute.name: Brightness of PWM output when motion detected
attribute.description: Configuration of the brightness value of PWM output when motion detected, this brightness value is controlled through PWM output working as PID closed loop control to achieve the constant light output. Value range is 0-1000LUX, 0LUX means this attribute is disabled, and PWM output when motion detected is not associated with the brightness value.

attribute.name: PWM output percentage when motion detected
attribute.description: Configuration of PWM output percentage when motion detected. Value Range is 0-254, which means 0-100%. When configured PID closed loop control brightness LUX is 0, PWM output of the device is according to this value.

attribute.name: Light on time (status 2nd delay)
attribute.description: After the light on time expires, the light status within the duration of 2nd delay time. Value Range is 0-254, which means 0-100%.

attribute.name: Light on time (duration 2nd delay)
attribute.description: After the light on time expires, the duration of 2nd delay time. Value range is 0-65536s.

attribute.name: Light status after expiration 2nd delay time
attribute.description: After the 2nd delay time expires, the status of the light. Value Range is 0-254, which means 0-100%.

attribute.name: Linearity error ratio coefficient of LUX measurement (M)
attribute.description: Default value is 1000, which means 1000 per mill. When increase the value of M, LUX measurement value will be magnified linearly. When decrease the value of M, LUX measurement value will be minified linearly. For instance, modify M value as 1001, LUX measurement value will be magnified to 1.001 times. Modify M value as 500, LUX measurement value will be magnified to 0.5 times.

attribute.name: Fixed deviation of LUX measurement
attribute.description: For instance, if we need to increase the measurement value by 100LUX, then this parameter value will be +100. If we need to decrease the measurement value by 100LUX, then this parameter value will be -100.

attribute.name: Light PWM Frequency
attribute.description: Works after reset power of the device, the device that directly outputs PWM can be configured, DO NOT set the PWM frequency too high which will affect the dimming resolution.

attribute.name: Xiaomi Disconnect 1
attribute.description: Set to 0x12 (0xFE) to connect (disconnect) the left button to (from) the relay.

attribute.name: Xiaomi Disconnect 2
attribute.description: Set to 0x22 (0xFE) to connect (disconnect) the left button to (from) the relay.

cluster.name: Power Configuration
cluster.description: Attributes for determining more detailed information about a device’s power source(s), and for configuring under/over voltage alarms.

cluster.name: Device Temperature Configuration
cluster.description: Attributes for determining information about a device’s internal temperature, and for configuring under/over temperature alarms.

cluster.name: Identify
cluster.description: Attributes and commands for putting a device into Identification mode (e.g. flashing a light)

command.name: Identify
command.description: Start or stop the device identifying itself.

attribute.name: Identify Time
attribute.description: The time in seconds for which a device will stay in identify mode.

command.name: Identify Query
command.description: Allows the sending device to request the target or targets to respond if they are currently identifying themselves.

command.name: Trigger Effect
command.description: The trigger effect command allows the support of feedback to the user, such as a certain light effect.

attribute.name: Effect identifier
attribute.description: The effect identifier field specifies the identify effect to use.

attribute.name: Effect variant
attribute.description: The effect identifier field specifies the identify effect to use.

command.name: Identify Query Response
command.description: Response of a identify query command.

attribute.name: Timeout
attribute.description: The time in seconds for which a device will stay in identify mode.

cluster.name: Groups
cluster.description: Attributes and commands for group configuration and manipulation.

command.name: Add group
command.description: Add a group to the device.

command.name: View group
command.description: Get the name of a group.

command.name: Get group membership
command.description: Get the group membership of the device.

command.name: Remove group
command.description: Remove a group from the device.

command.name: Remove all groups
command.description: Remove all group from the device.

command.name: Add group response
command.description: The Response to the add group request.

command.name: View group response
command.description: The Response to the view group request.

command.name: Get group membership response
command.description: The Response to the get group membership request.

command.name: Remove group response
command.description: The Response to the remove group request.

cluster.name: Scenes
cluster.description: Attributes and commands for scene configuration and manipulation.

command.name: Add scene
command.description: Add a scenes to the group (empty).

command.name: View scene
command.description: Views the scenes of a group.

command.name: Remove scene
command.description: Removes a scenes of a group.

command.name: Remove all scenes
command.description: Removes all scenes of a group.

command.name: Store scene
command.description: Stores a scene of a group for a device.

command.name: Recall scene
command.description: Recalls a scene of a group for a device.

command.name: Get scene membership
command.description: Get the scenes of a group for a device.

command.name: Enhanced view scene
command.description: Views the scenes of a group.

command.name: IKEA step
command.description: Command sent by TRADFRI remote control on press left or right. Set Direction to 1 for left or leave at 0 for right. Leave the Unknown parameters at their default values.

command.name: IKEA move
command.description: Command sent by TRADFRI remote control on hold left or right. Set Direction to 1 for left or leave at 0 for right. Leave the Unknown parameter at its default value.

command.name: IKEA stop
command.description: Command sent by TRADFRI remote control on release (after hold). Leave the Unknown parameter at its default value.

command.name: Add scene response
command.description: Response to the add scene command.

command.name: View scene response
command.description: Response to the view scene command.

command.name: Remove scene response
command.description: Response to the remove scene command.

command.name: Remove all scenes response
command.description: Response to the remove all scenes command.

command.name: Store scene response
command.description: Response to the store scene command.

command.name: Get scene membershio response
command.description: Shows details about scene membership.

command.name: Enhanced view scene response
command.description: A scene description.

cluster.name: On/Off
cluster.description: Attributes and commands for switching devices between 'On' and 'Off' states.

attribute.name: On Time Reload
attribute.description: Defines number of seconds before the light is switched off automaticaly. Time is in seconds. Value 0 disables the functionality. When brightness is changed, or ON command is received, timer is always restarted. Check On Time Reload Options for possible impulse modes (if attribute is implemented).

command.name: Off
command.description: On receipt of this command, a device shall enter its 'Off' state. This state is device dependent, but it is recommended that it is used for power off or similar functions.

command.name: On
command.description: On receipt of this command, a device shall enter its 'On' state. This state is device dependent, but it is recommended that it is used for power on or similar functions.

command.name: Toggle
command.description: On receipt of this command, if a device is in its ‘Off’ state it shall enter its 'On' state. Otherwise, if it is in its ‘On’ state it shall enter its 'Off' state.

attribute.name: Effect identifier
attribute.description: The effect identifier field specifies the fading effect to use.

attribute.name: Effect variant
attribute.description: The effect identifier field specifies the effect variant to use.

value.name: Fade off in 0.8s (Delayed all off)/20% dim up in 0.5s then off in 1s (Dying light)
50% dim down in 0.8s then fade off in 12s (Delayed all off)

command.name: On with recall global scene
command.description: The on with recall global scene command allows the recall of the light settings when the light was turned off.

command.name: On with timed off
command.description: Allows lamps to be turned on for a specific duration with a guarded off duration so that should the lamp be subsequently switched off, further on with timed off commands, received during this time, are prevented from turning the lamps back on.

attribute.name: On/off control
attribute.description: The effect identifier field specifies the fading effect to use.

attribute.name: On time
attribute.description: Length of time (in 1/10ths second) that the lamp is to remain on.

attribute.name: Off wait time
attribute.description: Length of time (in 1/10ths second) that the lamp shall remain off.

command.name: Safe Mode Off
command.description: The 'Safe mode off' functionality is the same as "Safe mode on" the only different is relay entering off state instead of on state.

command.name: Safe Mode On
command.description: If 'Safe mode On' command is sent to a relay with value 10 minutes, the relay will enter the safe mode after 10 minutes and force the relay to turn ON. If a standard OFF command from the On/Off cluster is sent within the first 10 minutes. The timer is restarted and the relay will not turn ON before the new 10 minute time has timed out. Sending the standard OFF command regularly within the 10 minute time interval will prevent the relay to enter safe mode ON state.

cluster.name: RGB Color
cluster.description: Attributes and commands for setting devices light color. The color is specified in the RGB range from 0 - 255.

command.name: Set Color
command.description: On receipt of this command, the color of the light shall be changed and the current index updatet.

cluster.name: On/Off Switch Configuration
cluster.description: Attributes and commands for configuring On/Off switching devices

attribute.name: SwitchType
attribute.description: The SwitchType attribute specifies the basic functionality of the On/Off switching device.

value.name: Toggle
value.description: A switch with two physical states. An action by the user (e.g. toggling a rocker switch) moves the switch from state 1 to state 2. The switch then remains in that state until another action from the user returns it to state 1.

value.name: Momentary
value.description: A switch with two physical states. An action by the user (e.g. pressing a button) moves the switch from state 1 to state 2. When the user ends his action (e.g. releases the button) the switch returns to state 1.

attribute.name: SwitchActions
attribute.description: The SwitchActions attribute is 8-bits in length and specifies the commands of the On/Off cluster to be generated when the switch moves between its two states.

cluster.name: Level Control
cluster.description: This cluster provides an interface for controlling a characteristic of a device that can be set to a level, for example the brightness of a light, the degree of closure of a door, or the power output of a heater.

attribute.name: Current Level
attribute.description: The CurrentLevel attribute represents the current level of this device. meaning of 'level' is device dependent.

attribute.name: Remaining Time
attribute.description: The RemainingTime attribute represents the time remaining until the current command is complete - it is specified in 1/10ths of a second.

attribute.name: Hue Min Dim Level
attribute.description: Percentage of the maximum lumen the device outputs on minimum brightness (in 0.001%).

attribute.name: OnOff Transistion Time
attribute.description: The OnOffTransitionTime attribute represents the time taken to move to or from the target level when On of Off commands are received by an On/Off cluster on the same endpoint. It is specified in 1/10ths of a second. The actual time taken should be as close to OnOffTransitionTime as the device is able.

attribute.name: On Level
attribute.description: The OnLevel attribute determines the value that the CurrentLevel attribute is set to when the OnOff attribute of an On/Off cluster on the same endpoint is set to On. If the OnLevel attribute is not implemented, or is set to 0xff, it has no effect.

attribute.name: On Transition Time
attribute.description: The OnTransitionTime attribute represents the time taken to move the current level from the minimum level to the maximum level when an On command is received by an On/Off cluster on the same endpoint. It is specified in 10ths of a second. If this command is not implemented, or contains a value of 0xffff, the On/OffTransitionTime will be used instead.

attribute.name: Off Transition Time
attribute.description: The OffTransitionTime attribute represents the time taken to move the current level from the maximum level to the minimum level when an Off command is received by an On/Off cluster on the same endpoint. It is specified in 10ths of a second. If this command is not implemented, or contains a value of 0xffff, the On/OffTransitionTime will be used instead.

attribute.name: Default Move Rate
attribute.description: The DefaultMoveRate attribute determines the movement rate, in units per second, when a Move command is received with a Rate parameter of 0xFF.

cluster.name: Alarms
cluster.description: Sending alarm notifications and configuring alarm functionality.

cluster.name: Time
cluster.description: This cluster provides a basic interface to a real-time clock.

cluster.name: Location
cluster.description: Measure distance between devices.

command.name: Distance measure response
command.description: Returns the result of a distance measure.

cluster.name: Analog Input (Basic)
cluster.description: An interface for reading the value of an analog measurement and accessing various characteristics of that measurement.

cluster.name: Analog Output (Basic)
cluster.description: The Analog Output (Basic) cluster provides an interface for setting the value of an analog output (typically to the environment) and accessing various characteristics of that value.

cluster.name: Analog Value (Basic)
cluster.description: An interface for setting an analog value, typically used as a control system parameter, and accessing various characteristics of that value.

cluster.name: Binary Input (Basic)
cluster.description: The Binary Input (Basic) cluster provides an interface for reading the value of a binary measurement and accessing various characteristics of that measurement. The cluster is typically used to implement a sensor that measures a two-state physical quantity.

cluster.name: Binary Output (Basic)
cluster.description: The Binary Output (Basic) cluster provides an interface for setting the value of a binary output, and accessing various characteristics of that value.

cluster.name: Binary Value (Basic)
cluster.description: The Binary Value (Basic) cluster provides an interface for setting a binary value, typically used as a control system parameter, and accessing various characteristics of that value.

cluster.name: Multistate Input (Basic)
cluster.description: Provides an interface for reading the value of a multistate measurement and accessing various characteristics of that measurement. The cluster is typically used to implement a sensor that measures a physical quantity that can take on one of a number of discrete states.

cluster.name: Multistate Output (Basic)
cluster.description: The Multistate Output (Basic) cluster provides an interface for setting the value of an output that can take one of a number of discrete values, and accessing characteristics of that value.

cluster.name: Multistate Value (Basic)
cluster.description: The Multistate Value (Basic) cluster provides an interface for setting a multistate value, typically used as a control system parameter, and accessing characteristics of that value.

cluster.name: Commissioning
cluster.description: Attributes and commands for commissioning and managing a ZigBee device.

command.name: Restart Device
command.description: The Restart Device command is used to optionally install a set of startup parameters in a device and run the startup procedure so as to put the new values into effect. The new values may take effect immediately or after an optional delay with optional jitter. The server will send a Restart Device Response command back to the client device before executing the procedure or starting the countdown timer required to time the delay.

command.name: Save Startup Parameters
command.description: The Save Startup Parameters Request command allows for the current attribute set to be stored under a given index.

command.name: Restore Startup Parameters
command.description: This command allows a saved startup parameters attribute set to be restored to current status overwriting whatever was there previously.

command.name: Reset Startup Parameters
command.description: This command allows current startup parameters attribute set and one or all of the saved attribute sets to be set to default values. There is also an option for erasing the index under which an attribute set is saved thereby freeing up storage capacity.

command.name: Restart Device Response
command.description: On receipt of this command the client is made aware that the server has received the corresponding request and is informed of the status of the request.

command.name: Save Startup Parameters Response
command.description: On receipt of this command the client is made aware that the server has received the corresponding request and is informed of the status of the request.

command.name: Restore Startup Parameters Response
command.description: On receipt of this command the client is made aware that the server has received the corresponding request and is informed of the status of the request.

command.name: Reset Startup Parameters Response
command.description: On receipt of this command the client is made aware that the server has received the corresponding request and is informed of the status of the request.

cluster.name: OTAU
cluster.description: Over the air upgrade.

cluster.name: Poll Control
cluster.description: Provides a mechanism for the management of an end device’s MAC Data Request rate.

command.name: Check-in
command.description: The Poll Control Cluster server sends out a Check-in command to the devices to which it is paired based on the server‘s Check-inInterval attribute. It does this to find out if any of the Poll Control Cluster Clients with which it is paired are interested in having it enter fast poll mode so that it can be managed. This request is sent out based on either the Check-inInterval, or the next Check-in value in the Fast Poll Stop Request generated by the Poll Control Cluster Client.

command.name: Stop
command.description: send Fast Poll Stop

command.name: Set Long Poll Interval
command.description: Sets the Read Only LongPollInterval attribute.

command.name: Set Short Poll Interval
command.description: Sets the Read Only ShortPollInterval attribute.

domain.name: Closures
domain.description: The closures functional domain contains clusters and information to build devices in the closure domain, e.g. shade controllers.

cluster.name: Shade Configuration
cluster.description: The shade configuration cluster provides an interface for reading information about a shade, and configuring its open and closed limits.

cluster.name: Door Lock
cluster.description: The door lock cluster provides an interface to a generic way to secure a door.

attribute-set.description: User, PIN, Schedule Information Attribute Set

attribute.name: Number Of WeekDay Schedules Supported Per User
Number Of Year Day Schedules Supported Per User

value.name: Use LED signalization except for access allowed events
Use LED signalization for all events
No RF Lock or Unlock Mode Supported

attribute-set.description: Alarm and Event Masks Attribute Set

value.name: Tamper Alarm – wrong code entry limit
Tamper Alarm - front escutcheon removed from main
Forced Door Open under Door Locked Condition
Unknown or manufacturer-specific RF operation event
Lock, source: RF, error: invalid code
Lock, source: RF, error: invalid schedule
Unlock, source: RF, error: invalid code
Unlock, source: RF, error: invalid schedule
Unknown or manufacturer-specific manual operation event

command.name: Lock Door
command.description: This command causes the lock device to lock the door.

command.name: Unlock Door
command.description: This command causes the lock device to unlock the door.

command.name: Toggle Door
command.description: This command toggle the lock device.

command.name: Unlock with timer
command.description: This command Unlock the lock device but with a timer.

command.name: Get Log Record
command.description: Request a log record.

command.name: Get Log Record Response
command.description: Returns the specified log record.

command.name: Set PIN code
command.description: Set PIN-code for user. User ID is between 0 and [# of PIN Users Supported Attribute]

command.name: Set PIN code response
command.description: Status

command.name: Get PIN code
command.description: Get PIN code for user. User ID is between 0 and [# of PIN Users Supported Attribute]

command.name: Get PIN code response
command.description: Returns PIN-code for user.

command.name: Clear PIN code
command.description: Clear PIN code for user. User ID is between 0 and [# of PIN Users Supported Attribute]

command.name: Clear PIN code response
command.description: Status

command.name: Clear all PIN codes
command.description: Clear all registred PIN codes.

command.name: Clear all PIN codes response
command.description: Status

command.name: Operationg Event Notification
command.description: The door lock server sends out operation event notification when the event is triggered by the various event sources.

cluster.name: Window Covering
cluster.description: The window covering cluster provides an interface for controlling and adjusting automatic window coverings such as drapery motors, automatic shades, and blinds.

attribute.name: Drive Close Duration
attribute.description: Obsolete (only because backward compatibility). Driving time from fully open to fully close state in seconds. If possible, use Lift Drive Up Time, Lift Drive Down Time. If you set this time, also both (Lift Drive Up Time, Lift Drive Down Time) are set to this value automatically.

attribute.name: Protection Status
attribute.description: The Protection Status attribute specifies the status of the different protections of the device. Can be active only if Protection Sensor attribute is set (protection sensor as external device must be connected to device). Bit0: 0 = sun protection not active, 1 = sun protection active. Other bits reserved.

attribute.name: Sun Protection Illuminance Threshold
attribute.description: Default value in lux is 1862 Lux. Value in attribute = 10000 x log10 1862 = 10000 x3.26 = around 32767. The Sun Protection Illuminance Threshold attribute specifies the illuminance level above which the device enters Sun Protection mode if enabled (if ProtectionSensor attribute is set = protection sensor is connected to device). Sun Protection Illuminance Threshold represents illuminance in Lux (symbol lx) as follows: Sun Protection Illuminance Threshold = 10,000 x log10 Illuminance Where 1lx gt Illuminance gt 3.576 Mlx, corresponding to a SunProtectionIlluminanceThreshold in the range 0 to 0xfffe. A value of 0xffff indicates that this attribute is not valid.

attribute.name: Protection Sensor
attribute.description: The ProtectionSensor attribute specifies if the sun protection sensor (as external device) is connected or device receives measurement from a type of protection sensor (either local wired or wireless). Bit0: 0 = sun protection sensor not connected, 1 = sun protection sensor connected Other bits reserved.

attribute.name: Lift Drive Up Time
attribute.description: Driving time from fully close to fully open state in1 /10 seconds.

attribute.name: Lift Drive Down Time
attribute.description: Driving time from fully open to fully close state in 1/10 seconds.

attribute.name: Tilt Open Close And Step Time
attribute.description: Time from fully open to fully close tilt position in 1/100 seconds. This time is also taken as base for calculation of step size in Schneider manufacture specific command Stop Or Step Lift Percentage. If set to 0, WindosCoveringType attribute is automatically set to 0 (lift only)

attribute.name: Tilt Position Percentage After Move To Level
attribute.description: Tilt position in percent adopted by tilt after receiving go to lift percentage command. Values 0-100 are absolute position of tilt with following meaning: 100: Position of tilt when shutter is moving up (usually up). 0: Position of tilt when shutter is moving down (usually down). 255: No action after command. 101-254: Tilt position before movement is restored.

domain.name: HVAC
domain.description: The HVAC functional domain contains clusters and information to build devices in the HVAC domain, e.g. pumps.

cluster.name: Pump Configuration and Control
cluster.description: An interface for configuring and controlling pumps.

cluster.name: Thermostat
cluster.description: Thermostat control cluster attributes and commands.

value.name: Simple/setpoint mode
value.description: 0 – This mode means the thermostat setpoint is altered only by manual up/down changes at the thermostat or remotely, not by internal schedule programming. 1 – Schedule programming mode. This enables or disables any programmed weekly schedule con-figurations. Note: It does not clear or delete previous weekly schedule programming configurations.

attribute.name: Main Cycle Output
attribute.description: Number of second

attribute.name: Aux Cycle Output
attribute.description: Number of second

value.name: Windows open from external, but detected closed

attribute.name: System Mode
attribute.description: States only supportedb by Stelpro thermostats (useless for Maestro).

attribute.name: Display LED Brightness
attribute.description: OLED brightness when operating the buttons. Default: Medium.

attribute.name: Button Vibration Level
attribute.description: Key beep volume and vibration level. Default: Low.

attribute.name: Floor Sensor Type
attribute.description: Type of the external floor sensor. Default: NTC 10K/25.

attribute.name: Control Type
attribute.description: The sensor used for heat control. Default: Room Sensor.

attribute.name: PowerUp Status
attribute.description: The mode after a power reset. Default: Previous Mode.

attribute.name: Floor Sensor Calibration
attribute.description: The tempearatue calibration for the exernal floor sensor, between -30 and 30 in 0.1°C. Default: 0.

attribute.name: Dry Time
attribute.description: The duration of Dry Mode, between 5 and 100 minutes. Default: 5.

attribute.name: Mode After Dry
attribute.description: The mode after Dry Mode. Default: Schedule.

attribute.name: Temperature Display
attribute.description: The temperature on the display. Default: Room Temperature.

attribute.name: Window Open Detection
attribute.description: The threshold to detect window open, between 3 and 8 in 0.5 °C. Default: 0 (disabled).

attribute.name: Hysteresis
attribute.description: Hysteresis setting, between 5 and 20 in 0.1 °C. Default: 5.

attribute.name: Alarm Air Temperature
attribute.description: Room temperature alarm threshold, between 20 and 60 in °C. 0 means disabled. Default: 45.

attribute.name: Away Mode
attribute.description: Set Away Mode. Default: Home.

command.name: Setpoint Raise/Lower
command.description: This command increases (or decreases) the setpoint(s) by amount, in steps of 0.1°C.

value.name: Both (adjust Heat Setpoint and Cool Setpoint)

attribute.name: Amount
attribute.description: The amount field is a signed 8-bit integer that specifies the amount the setpoint(s) are to be a increased (or decreased) by, in steps of 0.1°C.

value.name: Heat Setpoint Field Present in Payload
Cool Setpoint Field Present in Payload
Heat Setpoint Field Present in Payload
Cool Setpoint Field Present in Payload

command.name: Set Heating Setpoint
command.description:
Set immediately: The actuator will make a large movement to minimize reaction time.
Mimic Occupied Heating Setpoint Behavior: The behavior will be the same as setting the attribute "Occupied Heating Setpoint" to the same value.
Preserve Displayed Setpoint: Displayed setpoint is not affected, but regulated setpoint will change. Can be used for Forecast functionality.

command.name: Preheat
command.description: Request eTRV to enter pre-heat if in schedule mode and if other eTRV in same room has triggeed pre-heat.

attribute.name: Timestamp
attribute.description: Timestamp received from other eTRV in the same room that went into preheat.

value.name: Heat Setpoint Field Present in Payload
Cool Setpoint Field Present in Payload

cluster.name: Fan Control
cluster.description: This cluster specifies an interface to control the speed of a fan as part of a heating / cooling system.

cluster.name: Dehumidification Control
cluster.description: dfdf

cluster.name: Thermostat User Interface Configuration
cluster.description: This cluster provides an interface to allow configuration of the user interface for a thermostat, or a thermostat controller device, that supports a keypad and LCD screen.

attribute.name: Measurement interval, range: 3..255 seconds
attribute.description: Beware: While increasing the measurement interval should save power, it also increases the reaction time for reading/writing values in deCONZ up to the set value (the C401N only connects every n seconds to the Zigbee network). About 60s seems like a sweet spot between power saving and reaction time.

cluster.name: DE Debug
cluster.description: Attributes and commands for debugging purposes.

domain.name: Lighting
domain.description: The lighting functional domain contains clusters and information to build devices in the lighting domain, e.g. ballast units.

cluster.name: Color Control
cluster.description: Attributes and commands for controlling the color properties of a color-capable light.

value.name: Enhanced current hue and current saturation

attribute.name: Couple Color Temp To Min Mireds
Transition Time
attribute.description: The transition time in 1/10ths of a second.

attribute.name: Transition Time
attribute.description: The transition time in 1/10 seconds.

attribute.name: Transition Time
attribute.description: The transition time in 1/10 seconds.

attribute.name: Rate
attribute.description: The steps per second.

attribute.name: Transition Time
attribute.description: The transition time in 1/10 seconds.

attribute.name: Transition Time
attribute.description: The transition time in 1/10 seconds.

attribute.name: Transition Time
attribute.description: The transition time in 1/10 seconds.

attribute.name: Rate X
attribute.description: The steps per second.

attribute.name: Rate Y
attribute.description: The steps per second.

attribute.name: Transition Time

command.name: Stop move step

attribute.name: Color Temperature Min Mireds
attribute.description: Specifies a lower bound on the color temperature for the current move operation.

attribute.name: Color Temperature Max Mireds
attribute.description: Specifies a upper bound on the color temperature for the current move operation.

attribute.description: Specifies a lower bound on the color temperature for the current step operation.

attribute.name: Color Temperature Max Mireds

cluster.name: Ballast Configuration
cluster.description: Attributes and commands to configure a ballast.

attribute.name: Dimmer Mode
attribute.description: Sets dimming mode to autodetect or fixed RC/RL/RL_LED mode (max load is reduced in RL_LED)

domain.name: Measurement and sensing
domain.description: The measurement and sensing functional domain contains clusters and information to build devices in the measurement and sensing domain, e.g. a temperature sensor or an occupancy sensor.

cluster.name: Illuminance measurement
cluster.description: The server cluster provides an interface to illuminance measurement functionality, including configuration and provision of notifications of illuminance measurements.

attribute.name: Max Up Speed
attribute.description: Maximum up adjustment speed in 1/10 seconds.

attribute.name: Max Down Speed
attribute.description: Maximum down adjustment speed in 1/10 seconds.

attribute.name: Target Value
attribute.description: Target value in Lux which should be kept.

attribute.name: Startup Type
attribute.description: Brightness control startup type.

cluster.name: Temperature measurement
cluster.description: The server cluster provides an interface to temperature measurement functionality, including configuration and provision of notifications of temperature measurements.

cluster.name: Pressure measurement
cluster.description: The server cluster provides an interface to air pressure measurement functionality, including configuration and provision of notifications of air pressure measurements.

cluster.name: Flow measurement
cluster.description: The server cluster provides an interface to flow measurement measurement functionality, including configuration and provision of notifications of flow measurements.

attribute.name: Measured Value
attribute.description: Represents the flow in m3/h times 10

cluster.name: Relative humidity measurement
cluster.description: Percentage of water in the air

attribute.name: PIR Occupied To Unoccupied Delay
attribute.description: The PIROccupiedToUnoccupiedDelay attribute is 16-bits in length and specifies the time delay, in seconds, before the PIR sensor changes to its occupied state when the sensed area becomes unoccupied. This attribute, along with PIRUnoccupiedToOccupiedTime, may be used to reduce sensor 'chatter' when used in an area where occupation changes frequently.

attribute.name: PIR Unoccupied To Occupied Delay
attribute.description: The PIRUnoccupiedToOccupiedDelay attribute is 16-bits in length and specifies the time delay, in seconds, before the PIR sensor changes to its unoccupied state when the sensed area becomes occupied.

attribute.name: PIR Unoccupied To Occupied Threshold
attribute.description: The PIRUnoccupiedToOccupiedThreshold attribute is 8 bits in length and specifies the number of movement detection events that must occur in the period PIRUnoccupiedToOccupiedDelay, before the PIR sensor changes to its occupied state.

attribute.name: Ultrasonic Occupied To Unoccupied Delay
attribute.description: The UltraSonicOccupiedToUnoccupiedDelay attribute specifies the time delay, in seconds, before the ultrasonic sensor changes to its occupied state when the sensed area becomes unoccupied. This attribute, along with UltraSonicUnoccupiedToOccupiedTime, may be used to reduce sensor 'chatter' when used in an area where occupation changes frequently.

attribute.name: Ultrasonic Unoccupied To Occupied Delay
attribute.description: The UltraSonicUnoccupiedToOccupiedDelay attribute specifies the time delay, in seconds, before the ultrasonic sensor changes to its unoccupied state when the sensed area becomes occupied.

attribute.name: Ultrasonic Unoccupied To Occupied Threshold
attribute.description: The UltrasonicUnoccupiedToOccupiedThreshold attribute is 8 bits in length and specifies the number of movement detection events that must occur in the period PIRUnoccupiedToOccupiedDelay, before the PIR sensor changes to its occupied state.

attribute.name: Physical Contact Occupied To Unoccupied Delay
attribute.description: The PhysicalContactOccupiedToUnoccupiedDelay attribute specifies the time delay, in seconds, before the Physical Contact sensor changes to its occupied state when the sensed area becomes unoccupied. This attribute, along with UltraSonicUnoccupiedToOccupiedTime, may be used to reduce sensor 'chatter' when used in an area where occupation changes frequently.

attribute.name: Physical Contact Unoccupied To Occupied Delay
attribute.description: The PhysicalContactUnoccupiedToOccupiedDelay attribute specifies the time delay, in seconds, before the Physical Contact sensor changes to its unoccupied state when the sensed area becomes occupied.

attribute.name: Physical Contact Unoccupied To Occupied Threshold
attribute.description: The PhysicalContactUnoccupiedToOccupiedThreshold attribute is 8 bits in length and specifies the number of movement detection events that must occur in the period PIRUnoccupiedToOccupiedDelay, before the PIR sensor changes to its occupied state.

cluster.name: Leaf Wetness measurement
cluster.description: Percentage of water on the leaves of plants

cluster.name: Soil Moisture measurement
cluster.description: Percentage of water in the soil

cluster.name: pH Measurement
cluster.description: Provides an interface to pH measurement functionality

attribute.name: Measured Value
attribute.description: "Represents the pH with no units as follows: Measured Value = 100 x pH"

cluster.name: Electrical Conductivity
cluster.description: Provides an interface to Electrical Conductivity measurement functionality

attribute.name: Measured Value
attribute.description: "Electrical Conductivity in mS/m. The maximum resolution this format allows is 0.1"

cluster.name: Wind Speed Measurement
cluster.description: Provides an interface to Wind Speed Measurement functionality

attribute.name: Measured Value
attribute.description: "100 x Wind Speed in m/s. The maximum resolution this format allows is 0.01"

cluster.description: Typical range example: not detected to 3.6 PPB. Typical value example:1.79 PPB

cluster.description: Percent of positive samples. Typical range example: 0 to 100%. Typical value example: 1.33%

cluster.name: Turbidity measurement
cluster.description: Cloudiness of particles in water where an average person would notice a 5 or higher. Typical range example: 0 to 10. Typical value example: 0.18

cluster.name: Copper measurement
cluster.description: Typical range example: 0 to 10 PPM. Typical value example: 0.191 PPM

cluster.name: Lead measurement
cluster.description: Typical range example: 0 to 10 PPB. Typical value example: 3.2 PPB

cluster.name: Manganese measurement
cluster.description: Typical range example: 0 to 1000 PPB. Typical value example: 31 PPB

cluster.name: Sulfate measurement
cluster.description: Typical range example: 0 to 1000 PPB. Typical value example: 36 PPB

cluster.name: Bromodichloromethane measurement
cluster.description: Typical range example: 0 to 1000 PPB. Typical value example: 9.6 PPB

cluster.name: Bromoform measurement
cluster.description: Typical range example: 0 to 1000 PPB. Typical value example: 1.1 PPB

cluster.name: Chlorodibromomethane measurement
cluster.description: Typical range example: 0 to 1000 PPB. Typical value example: 6.4 PPB

cluster.description: Typical range example: 0 to 1000 PPB. Typical value example: 8.0 PPB

cluster.name: Sodium measurement
cluster.description: Typical range example: 0 to 1000 PPB. Typical value example: 27 PPB

cluster.name: PM2.5 Measurement
cluster.description: Particulate Matter 2.5 microns or less

cluster.name: PM1 Measurement
cluster.description: PM1 concentration measurement

cluster.name: PM10 Measurement
cluster.description: PM10 concentration measurement

cluster.name: VOC Measurement
cluster.description: Volatile Organic Compounds concentration measurement.Typical range example: 0 to 10 PPM. Typical value example: 1.11 PPM

cluster.name: Electrical Measurement
cluster.description: Provides a mechanism for querying data about the electrical properties as measured by the device.

attribute-set.description: AC (Single Phase or Phase A) Measurements

attribute.name: Active Power
attribute.description: Represents the single phase or Phase A, current demand of active power delivered or received at the premises, in Watts (W). Positive values indicate power delivered to the premises where negative values indicate power received from the premises.

cluster.name: Diagnostics
cluster.description: The diagnostics cluster provides access to information regarding the operation of the ZigBee stack over time.

attribute.name: Phy to MAC queue limit reached
Avg MAC Retry per APS Msg Sent

cluster.name: IAS Zone
cluster.description: The IAS Zone cluster defines an interface to the functionality of an IAS security zone device. IAS Zone supports up to two alarm types per zone, low battery reports and supervision of the IAS network.

value.name: Enrolled
value.description: The client will react to Zone State Change Notification commands from the server.

cluster.name: IAS ACE
cluster.description: The IAS ACE cluster defines an interface to the functionality of any Ancillary Control Equipment of the IAS system. Using this cluster, a ZigBee enabled ACE device can access a IAS CIE device and manipulate the IAS system, on behalf of a level-2 user.

value.name: Panel disarmed (all zones disarmed) and ready to arm
Panel disarmed (all zones disarmed) and ready to arm

cluster.name: IAS WD
cluster.description: The IAS WD cluster provides an interface to the functionality of any Warning Device equipment of the IAS system. Using this cluster, a ZigBee enabled CIE device can access a ZigBee enabled IAS WD device and issue alarm warning indications (siren, strobe lighting, etc.) when a system alarm condition is detected.

domain.name: Security and safety
domain.description: The security and safety functional domain contains clusters and information to build devices in the security and safety domain, e.g. alarm units.

domain.name: Protocol interfaces
domain.description: The protocol interfaces functional domain contains clusters and information to build devices to interface to other protocols, e.g. BACnet.

cluster.name: Price
cluster.description: The Price Cluster provides the mechanism for communicating Gas, Energy, or Water pricing information within the premise. This pricing information is distributed to the ESP from either the utilities or from regional energy providers.

cluster.name: Demand Response and Load Control
cluster.description: This cluster provides an interface to the functionality of Smart Energy Demand Response and Load Control. Devices targeted by this cluster include thermostats and devices that support load control.

cluster.name: Simple Metering
cluster.description: The Simple Metering Cluster provides a mechanism to retrieve usage information from Electric, Gas, Water, and potentially Thermal metering devices. These devices can operate on either battery or mains power, and can have a wide variety of sophistication.

value.name: Number Digits Right
value.description: Number of Digets to the right of the Decimal Point

value.name: Number Digits Left
value.description: Number of Digets to the left of the Decimal Point

value.name: Number Digits Right
value.description: Number of Digets to the right of the Decimal Point

value.name: Number Digits Left
value.description: Number of Digets to the left of the Decimal Point

value.name: Pulse Counting on an Electricity Meter – Unit KWh
Pulse Counting on a Gas Meter – Unit m3
Pulse Counting on a Water Meter – Unit m3

cluster.name: Message
cluster.description: This cluster provides an interface for passing text messages between ZigBee devices.

cluster.name: Smart Energy Tunneling (Complex Metering)
cluster.description: The tunneling cluster provides an interface for tunneling protocols.

domain.name: Appliances
domain.description: The Appliance clusters are typically used in ZigBee appliance management.

cluster.name: Appliance Control
cluster.description: The Appliance Control cluster provides an interface to remotely control and to program household appliances. Example of control is Start, Stop and Pause commands.

cluster.name: Appliance Identification
cluster.description: Attributes and commands for determining basic information about a device and setting user device information. The Appliance Identification Cluster is a transposition of EN50523 "Identify Product" functional block.

cluster.name: Meter Identification
cluster.description: Attributes and commands that provide an interface to meter identification.

cluster.name: Appliance Events and Alerts
cluster.description: Attributes and commands for transmitting or notifying the occurrence of an event, such as "temperature reached" and of an alert such as alarm, fault or warning. It is based on the "Signal event" syntax of EN50523 and completed where necessary.

command.name: Get Alerts
command.description: The get group identifiers request command is used to retrieve the actual group identifiers that the endpoint is using in its multicast communication in controlling different (remote) devices.

cluster.name: Appliance Statistics
cluster.description: The Appliance Statistics provides a mechanism for transmitting appliance statistics to a collection unit (gateway). The statistics can be in format of data logs.

domain.name: Light Link
domain.description: The light link domain contains clusters and information that provides ZLL specific functions and attributes.

cluster.name: Touchlink Commissioning
cluster.description: Attributes and commands for touchlink commissioning.

command.name: Get group identifiers
command.description: The get group identifiers request command is used to retrieve the actual group identifiers that the endpoint is using in its multicast communication in controlling different (remote) devices.

command.name: Get endpoint list
command.description: The get endpoint list request command is used to retrieve addressing information for each endpoint the device is using in its unicast communication in controlling different (remote) devices.

command.name: Write MAC address
command.description: Non standard write MAC address (DDEL).

command.name: Get group identifiers response
command.description: The get group identifiers response command allows a remote device to respond to the get group identifiers request command.

command.name: Get endpoint list response
command.description: The get group identifiers response command allows a remote device to respond to the get group identifiers request command.

domain.name: Green Power
domain.description: The green power domain contains clusters and information that provides ZGP specific functions and attributes.

cluster.name: Green Power
cluster.description: Attributes and commands.

attribute.description: The optional GP functionality supported by this sink that is active.

attribute.name: Min Dim Level
attribute.description: Minimum Level represents the minimum level the dimmer can be set to. This must be lower than Maximum Level.

attribute.name: Max Dim Level
attribute.description: Maximum Level represents the maximum level the dimmer can be set to. This must be greater than Minimum Level.

attribute.name: Locator LED
attribute.description: Represents how the Locator LED functions. This can be set to ALWAYS ON (0x00), ALWAYS OFF (0X01), or a timed delay (0x02 to 0xFF). The Timed delay is always seconds -1. When using timed delay, the led will come on when a button is pressed.

attribute.name: Dimming LED
attribute.description: Represents how the Dimming LED functions. This can be set to ALWAYS ON (0x00), ALWAYS OFF (0X01), or a timed delay (0x02 to 0xFF). The Timed delay is always seconds -1. When using timed delay, the led will come on when a button is pressed.

attribute.name: Initial On Level
attribute.description: Initial On Level represents the desired level to be applied to a dimmer when an “On” button is pressed. 0x00 : Go to the last level set. 0x01-0xFF : Go to a specific level

attribute.name: Power Restore
attribute.description: Power Restore represents the option to turn the switch/dimmer back to its previous level when powered up, or remain off.

value.name: Go to the last level set

attribute.name: Press and Hold Time
attribute.description: Represents the ramp time when pressing and holding the dim/brighten button on a dimmer. This value represents the amount of time needed to go from 0% to 100%. This time value is in 0.1s increments

cluster.name: Lumi specific
cluster.description: Lumi specific attributes.

attribute.description: Switch mode: 1 - event based switching, 2 - zigbee group switching, 3 - Xiaomi specific switching

attribute.description: Time in seconds when RTCGQ13LM sets motion to false if no further motion has been detected

attribute.name: Motion sensitivity
attribute.description: Motion sensitivity: 1 - low, 2 - medium, 3 - high

attribute.description: 0 - µg/m³ + °C, 1 - ppb + °C, 16 - µg/m³ + °F, 17 - ppb + °F

attribute.name: Air Quality
attribute.description: Air Quality: 1 - excellent, 2 - good, 3 - moderate, 4 - poor, 5 unhealthy

attribute.description: Temperature (°C)

attribute.name: Humidity
attribute.description: Relative humidity (%)

attribute.name: Air quality
attribute.description: Air quality VOC (ppm)

attribute.name: Brightness
attribute.description: Ambient light brightness (lux)

attribute.name: Loudness
attribute.description: Noise level (dB)

attribute.name: timestamp
attribute.description: Relative timestamp since start(seconds)

attribute.name: Trigger
attribute.description: Trigger of this measurement

attribute.name: ModeOfOperation
attribute.description: Device orientation

cluster.name: VOC Measurement
cluster.description: Develco specific attributes.

cluster.name: Niko specific
cluster.description:
Niko specific attributes.
LED color: 0 - off, 255 - white, 65280 - blue, 16711680 - red Child lock on: 0, Child lock off: 1 LED on: 1, LED off: 0 0x0300: Switches permission to write either to 0x0202 (1) or to 0x0302 (0) Writing 1 to 0x0202 and 0x0302 makes 0x0300 writable. Then writing 1 to 0x0300 sets 0x0300 bitmap from 0x11 to 0x12, but block all other writes to 0x03XX attributes.

cluster.name: Datek on/off configuration
cluster.description: Datek on/off configuration attributes.

cluster.name: Datek diagnostics
cluster.description: Datek diagnostics cluster attributes.

cluster.name: Schneider specific
cluster.description: Schneider manufacturer-specifc cluster.

attribute.name: Indicator Luminance Level
attribute.description: Brightness of indication front LED. 0 = 100 percent 1 = 80 percent 2 = 60 percent 3 = 40 percent 4 = 20 percent 5 = 0 percent

attribute.name: LED indication
attribute.description: Allows to select the LED indicator mode: 0: Consistent With Load - The LED on the Socket Outlet is On when the device is On 1: Reverse With Load - The LED on the Socket Outlet is On when the device is Off 2: Always Off - The LED on the Socket Outlet is always Off 3: Always On - The LED on the Socket Outlet is always On

attribute.name: Local Control
attribute.description: 0 = local control is active 1 = local control is inactive User can not: A) control device locally (OF/OFF) B) activate e-mode User can: A) clear alarm locally

cluster.name: Schneider specific
cluster.description: Schneider manufacturer-specifc cluster.

attribute.name: Switch Indication
attribute.description: Attribute is shared between all endpoints where this cluster is presented. Attribute defines the meaning of indicator (LED) on the device, which provides the feedback to user about state of output.

value.name: Indicator is on when load is on
Indicator is on when load is off

attribute.name: Switch Actions
attribute.description: Default values depends on endpoint and device type. More info you find in device description. If value is one of non defined, switch does not send any action when pressed.

attribute.name: Up Scene ID
attribute.description: The Up Scene ID attribute represents the Scene Id field value of any Scene command cluster transmitted by the device when user activates is rocker up side according to the rocker configuration. See Switch Actions attribute.

attribute.name: Up Group ID
attribute.description: The Up Group ID attribute represents the Group Id field value of any Scene command cluster transmitted by the device when user activates is rocker up side according to the rocker configuration. Value greater than 0xFFF7 means, no command is sent. See Switch Actions attribute.

attribute.name: Down Scene ID
attribute.description: The Down Scene ID attribute represents the Scene Id field value of any Scene command cluster transmitted by the device when user activates is rocker down side according to the rocker configuration. See Switch Actions attribute.

attribute.name: Down Group ID
attribute.description: The Down Group ID attribute represents the Group Id field value of any Scene command cluster transmitted by the device when user activates is rocker down side according to the rocker configuration. Value greater than 0xFFF7 means, no command is sent. See Switch Actions attribute.

profile.name: Home Automation
profile.description: This profile defines device descriptions and standard practices for applications needed in a residential or light commercial environment. Installation scenarios range from a single room to an entire home up to 20,000 square feet (approximately 1850m2).

profile.name: Smart Energy
profile.description: This profile defines device descriptions and standard practices for Demand Response and Load Management 'Smart Energy' applications needed in a Smart Energy based residential or light commercial environment.

profile.name: Light Link
profile.description: This profile defines device descriptions and standard practices for ZigBee Light Link.

profile.name: Green Power
profile.description: This profile defines device descriptions and standard practices for ZigBee Green Power.

profile.name: Drop-In Networking
profile.description: This profile defines the Digi Drop-In Networking used by the XBee.

device.name: Develco Utility
device.description: Private profile for internal Develco Products use only.

profile.name: Leviton Manufacturer Specific Profile
profile.description: Profile used by Leviton Decora Smart switch.
